Description: Rim sherd (with turn of body) of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: eight lines between bands; glazed black on wall; exterior glazed black; reserved handle zone.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type A2 (possibly)
Curator's comments: Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, the profile and decoration find parallels with his South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 5C. These cups are both the earliest South Ionian cups at Naukratis and are relatively rare at the site. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18), Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116), and and Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type A2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.077) (Phase 3)
